props.synopsis: Golfer Steven Alderson made international headlines when he became the first winner with autism on the Golf for the Disabled Tour. He hopes to use his success to inspire others living with autism to chase their dreams.

title.children: Bullied golf champion Steve Alderson hopes to become a beacon for others living with autism

image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks - woman with black jacket and blue shirt and short hair walks out of coroners court

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that multiple attempts to escalate an emergency response were made after a ramping-related death in Adelaide, but staff were told the situation did not meet the criteria.

title.children: Hospital boss's attempt to escalate emergency response after ramping-related death denied, court hears

image.altText: A stethoscope on a white surface

props.synopsis: South Australian general practitioner Hemant Kumar Vanmali began an inappropriate relationship with a patient, who was aged in her 80s, "almost immediately" after her last consultation.

title.children: Doctor suspended over inappropriate relationship with elderly patient

image.altText: Man with head torch stands over a large flower

props.synopsis: Hand-pollination of the pungent corpse flower results in hundreds of seeds that will be sent across the world to help preserve the endangered species.

title.children: Adelaide corpse flowers spread endangered stench worldwide

image.altText: Shark carcass lies on the sand along the beach

props.synopsis: Research confirms a great white shark that washed up on a beach in south-west Victoria was the victim of killer whale predation.

title.children: Bite mark swabs show orcas killed 4.7m great white shark

image.altText: A group including members of the National Socialist Network.

props.synopsis: Neo-Nazi leader refuses to sign his bail forms while 14 men were granted bail after their involvement in a far-right rally on the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi refuses to sign bail forms as 14 others from Australia Day rally released

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Virgin has confirmed it will "indefinitely suspend" its Darwin to Adelaide service, saying it will add more direct flights between the Top End and other capital cities.

title.children: 'Unbelievable': Virgin suspends flights between Darwin and Adelaide

image.altText: An aerial photo of fire damage near Nhill

props.synopsis: Katelynn Clark felt certain her home would burn to the ground when a raging bushfire hit the edge of her rural property on Monday night.

title.children: Authorities warn against complacency as western Victoria bushfires grow

image.altText: Big black cockie with white marking on tail, perched on gum tree branch, holding a feather

props.synopsis: The deadly Wangary bushfire 20 years ago appears to have been the final nail in the coffin for yellow-tailed black cockatoos in South Australia's Eyre Peninsula. Ecologists are calling for urgent action before it's too late.

title.children: Help needed to save the last cockatoos restricted to this region

image.altText: Dan Cregan speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: South Australian Police Minister Dan Cregan is quitting state cabinet, citing "pressing family matters", triggering a reshuffle ahead of his retirement from politics at the next election.

title.children: SA minister quits cabinet ahead of retirement from politics

image.altText: Asian-looking smiling man, light suit, and woman, short hair, dark suit, tie, earrings, sit in front of  haystack, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Julie Mar says she has sometimes gone without buying groceries to fund her husband's partner visa. A solicitor says the application process can cost upwards of $9,000.

title.children: Partner visa expense and delay cause heartache for married couple

image.altText: aerial shot of Adelaide's water desalination plant

props.synopsis: Desalination production south of Adelaide is set to quadruple as local reservoirs fall to 44 per cent capacity, with dry conditions causing the lowest inflows in over 40 years.

title.children: Desalination plant to 'ramp up' as reservoir levels drop to 20-year low

image.altText: The entrance to a tunnel with a concrete floor, surrouned by industrial equipment.

props.synopsis: The trouble-plagued Snowy Hydro 2.0 project has been hit with another delay, as work stopped on two key tunnelling projects.

title.children: Concerns over 'last resort' for trapped workers prompts further Snowy 2.0 delays

image.altText: An elephant inside a cage with a zookeeper standing outside

props.synopsis: Perth Zoo's last remaining female elephant, Permai, is on the road to her forever home at South Australia's Monarto Safari Park.

title.children: Sadness as 'unique' Perth Zoo elephant leaves for new life in South Australia

image.altText: A beached beaked whale near a river

props.synopsis: A wildlife ranger says the discovery of a beached whale, believed to be a beaked whale, on South Australia's Kangaroo Island is a "peculiar" occurrence.

title.children: 'Elusive deep-water' whale found beached on Kangaroo Island

image.altText: Julianne Hancock stands wearing brown sunglasses, a blue and green shirt and white pants in front of the Murray River.

props.synopsis: A shortage of qualified instructors has made adult swimming lessons harder to find despite a rise in drownings.

title.children: Town offers adult swimming lessons to reduce drowning rate

image.altText: A female teacher with red hair leans down to the desk of a primary-school student to help her with a question in class.

props.synopsis: Experts warn Australia's education system is "failing to deliver" for half a million kids and putting their future wellbeing at risk, but lessons from 2024 offer hope.

title.children: As Australian students underperform, one group is bucking the trend

image.altText: A suited arm points to a large sign with a clock at 11.58 and 'It is 2 minutes to Midnight' on it.

props.synopsis: The Doomsday Clock has been reset by scientists to 89 seconds to midnight - closer than ever before to global catastrophe

title.children: Doomsday Clock closer to midnight amid AI emergence and Russian nuclear threat

image.altText: A plan sits on the tarmac of an airport being doused by water from cranes after catching alight

props.synopsis: The incident comes in the wake of 179 people dying when a plane skidded off a runway at a different airport in the country last month.

title.children: Passenger plane catches fire at South Korean airport

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Slices of body parts covered in Perspex and put on display on walls.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Coroner's Office is investigating whether body parts from coronial autopsies have been collected and held in a university museum without the knowledge of consent of families. The office has now published the names of more than 120 people who may have been affected.

title.children: Names of people whose body parts may have been kept without consent released

image.altText: The word 2025 in the shape of a snake on a red background

props.synopsis: How much do you know about the Year of the Snake and unique Lunar New Year traditions in Asian countries? Put your knowledge to the test with these 10 questions and see if you're a true Lunar New Year expert!

title.children: Get to know the upcoming Year of the Snake with 10 questions

image.altText: Riot police hold back some protests out with a tyre on fire behind them on a street in the Congo.

props.synopsis: Fighting between the Democratic Republic of Congo's military and Rwanda-backed rebel group M23 has intensified in recent days, prompting the United Nations to issue a warning.

title.children: Why the UN is sounding the alarm about a rebellion in Congo

image.altText: A photo of a fish head with lots of little yellow eggs in its mouth

props.synopsis: Researchers are on edge at the discovery of the tilapia in the Mitchell River after post-cyclone flooding spreads the invasive pest further in Far North Queensland.

title.children: 'Cane toad' of river systems creeps towards Gulf of Carpentaria

image.altText: close up of cargo ship with vezhen written on side

props.synopsis: The Baltic Sea region is on high alert as fears grow that Russia could target undersea cables as part of a wider campaign of so-called "hybrid warfare".

title.children: Baltic Sea region on high alert due to threat of Russia's shadow fleet

image.altText: the torsos of two young children in school uniforms

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police is advising caregivers to be vigilant about the information they share on social media.

title.children: 'You put your child at risk': The danger of back-to-school photos

image.altText: A phone with DeepSeek on it. Behind it is a screen with ChatGPT

props.synopsis: When little-known Chinese company DeepSeek launched its own surprisingly capable artificial intelligence chatbot, the sector panicked. Today, Professor Michael Blumenstein from the Australian Artificial Intelligence Institute at UTS tells us how it could change the entire AI landscape.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Did China just jump ahead in the AI race?

image.altText: Serbian Prime Minister Milos Vucevic speaks from behind a lectern

props.synopsis: Serbian Prime Minister Milos Vucevic has quit after a series of anti-government protests which followed anger over the fatal collapse of a train station bridge

title.children: Serbian Prime Minister quits amid anti-corruption protests

image.altText: An affordable housing building in Melbourne's south-east, seen from the street.

props.synopsis: Freedom of Information documents show inspectors from Victoria's building watchdog identified dozens of potential issues in an affordable housing block months before the state government finalised its sale.

title.children: Housing block bought by Vic government deemed 'medium risk' by inspectors

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old, who cannot be named to protect the identity of the child, appeared in the Brisbane Magistrates Court on Tuesday, where she made an application for bail.

title.children: Influencer accused of drugging baby daughter with anticonvulsant medication

image.altText: A black and white photo of a woman sitting at a table with a book open, looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A controversial memoir of a Finnish woman who migrated to Stalin’s Soviet Russia in the 1930s and escaped in 1941. Ninety years later, her granddaughter has translated the diary into English.

title.children: How one woman's diary became one of Finland's most banned books

image.altText: Ruby Vo smiles, holding some flowers in a room.

props.synopsis: It's a colourful, spear-shaped flower that grows all year round — but at the moment you might find it hard to get your hands on a gladiolus.

title.children: The bright red gladiolus offers good fortune at Lunar New Year

image.altText: A woman speaking and pointing

props.synopsis: Osama Elmasry Njeem, who was wanted for alleged crimes against humanity, was freed last week and flown home by an Italian state aircraft.

title.children: Italy's Giorgia Meloni under investigation after release of Libyan officer

image.altText: close of donald trump inside air force one airplane

props.synopsis: The decision by Donald Trump's administration could affect trillions of dollars and cause widespread disruption in health care research, education programs and other initiatives.

title.children: Trump to pause all federal grants and loans, memo reveals

image.altText: matthew huttle headshot

props.synopsis: An Indiana man who was recently pardoned by US President Donald Trump for his participation in the January 6 riots has been shot and killed by a deputy at a traffic stop.

title.children: January 6 rioter pardoned by Trump shot and killed by police
